intro: Scoliaxon, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Scoliaxon is native to temperate regions of Europe and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
